image.altText: Man with grey hair and beard in blue check jacket walking

props.synopsis: Craig Garland, who is standing for re-election next month for Tasmania's parliament, pleads guilty to a drug-driving charge.

title.children: Tasmanian MP pleads guilty to a drug-driving charge

image.altText: Eighteen officials stand on a blue deck of a new ship and line up for a photo.

props.synopsis: The second of the two new Spirit of Tasmania ships has been handed over to TT-Line by a Finnish ship-building company Rauma Marine Constructions.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania V officially handed over to ferry operator TT-Line

image.altText: A builder shovels gravel next to a digger.

props.synopsis: There are calls for the age pension to kick in sooner for manual labourers who are physically struggling to work until retirement age.

title.children: Tradies with 'destroyed' bodies want pension before 67

image.altText: Two lead smelters side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The owner of the Port Pirie and Hobart smelters says its operations will "simply not survive" without taxpayer support to combat alleged market distortion from China.Â

title.children: Port Pirie, Hobart smelters 'cannot be viable' without government help

image.altText: a man reclines near a cement plinth on a grassy lawn

props.synopsis: The discovery of missing war memorial plaques from a public soldiers' walk in Hobart has angered and dismayed a community group, calling the thieves "scumbags".

title.children: 'It's a war memorial. A sacred place': Dismay over stolen WWI plaques

image.altText: Side profile of Guy Barnett and Jeremy Rockliff.

props.synopsis: The blame game begins after Tasmania's Treasury finds the 2028 state debt will be $3 billion worse than predicted in the May state budget.Â

title.children: Tasmanian debt to be $3 billion worse than Liberal projection, Treasury finds

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: Mandatory pre-commitment cards for poker machine players, aimed to limit the harm for problem gamblers, won't be introduced in Tasmania unless other states and territories agree to a national approach on the issue, the Premier Rockliff says.

title.children: Pokies pre-commitment card won't go ahead without 'national approach'

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing to the stadium.

title.children: Salmon tax, hunting ban and all the other election promises

image.altText: Close up of Donald Trump talking

props.synopsis: NATO members are now adjusting to the possibility of reshaping their alliance without the United States but the UN Security Council, which will soon turn 80, is far less able to adapt.

title.children: After 80 years, the UN faces a whole new world â and Trump is testing it

image.altText: Mitch Georgiades celebrates a goal with Zak Butters

props.synopsis: Carlton is held to just one goal in the first half against Port Adelaide as under-fire coach Michael Voss decides to leave his coaches' box midway through the second quarter. Follow live.

title.children: 'Looks like a group that has lost belief': Carlton obliterated in first half by Port

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Voss moves down to the bench to assess the damage

image.altText: A man gestures to his teammates during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: A moment of desperation from Nathan Cleary has given Penrith a narrow lead in their showdown with Canterbury. Follow live.Â

title.children: Cleary pounces to give Penrith lead over Canterbury

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 55' Cleary charges it down and scores!
34' Preston crosses for the first try of the night

image.altText: Ley walks through crowd, Anne Ruston walks behind her.

props.synopsis: This week in politics Sussan Ley fronts the National Press Club, job cuts are coming for Parliament House and questions remain unanswered about US military operations on Australian shores.

title.children: Ley treads where Dutton didn't dare, Albanese grounds Airbus Albo

image.altText: night shot of couple sitting at plastic table and chairs front of green neon lights of cannabis leaves and shop stock

props.synopsis: Thailand, one of the first Asian countries to legalise cannabis use, has backflipped and banned non-prescription sales.

title.children: Thailand reverses recreational cannabis law, banning non-prescriptive sales

image.altText: Watercolour illustration of aboriginal child riding a 44 gallon drum tied between two trees.

props.synopsis: Young stockman Wylie Oscar went missing in outback Western Australia three years ago. His case remains a mystery

title.children: The outback is keeping secrets in the search for Wylie Oscar

image.altText: A woman embraces a group of people outside court

props.synopsis: On Wednesday, the Federal Court ruled that Antoinette Lattouf was unlawfully terminated by the ABC in December 2023. This is what we know about what will happen next.

title.children: Why the Lattouf v ABC legal saga isn't over yet

props.synopsis: Organisers of an event to promote women's safety are disappointed and shocked after several women reported inappropriate behaviour while participating in the Take Back the Track run on Wednesday night.

title.children: Women assaulted on safety fun run in Alice Springs

image.altText: Two women and a man walks down a plane aisle towards the exit as a flight attendant smiles

props.synopsis: The first group of Australians arrive home on a military-assisted flight from Israel as airlines continue to deal with challenges in the Middle East.

title.children: Australian's 26-hour airport wait to leave the Middle East

image.altText: An aerial shot of the outside of a mining site, as a crane pulls a claw-like attachment from a bore hole.

props.synopsis: With the help of laser sensors, drones and a robot dog, workers are preparing to re-enter one of Queensland's largest steelmaking coal mines one year on from an underground fire.

title.children: Mining giant prepares to re-enter Queensland coal mine after explosion

image.altText: Miley Cyrus stands for a photo wearing a black, silver and purple dress with houses and trees below her in the background.

props.synopsis: Unable to tour for health reasons, Miley Cyrus has made a visual album she has described as similar to Pink Floyd's The Wall, but "with a better wardrobe".Â

title.children: Miley Cyrus can't tour anymore, so she made a one-night cinema spectacular

image.altText: a man reclines near a cement plinth on a grassy lawn

props.synopsis: The discovery of missing war memorial plaques from a public soldiers' walk in Hobart has angered and dismayed a community group, calling the thieves "scumbags".

title.children: 'It's a war memorial. A sacred place': Dismay over stolen WWI plaques

image.altText: A middle-aged wearing a suit smiles

props.synopsis: Canadian filmmaker Denis Villeneuve is set to direct the next James Bond movie, Amazon MGM Studios announces.Â

title.children: Oscar-nominated filmmaker Denis Villeneuve to direct next James Bond film

image.altText: aerial image of police car at scene of alleged assault in wheatsheaf

props.synopsis: A former Australian Army reservist who murdered his neighbour by throwing petrol on him and lighting him on fire will be in his 90s by the time he is eligible for parole.

title.children: 'Sad, angry' man jailed for 35 years after lighting neighbour on fire

image.altText: Josh Inglis crouches down

props.synopsis: The more things change, the more they stay the same, as Australia's reshuffled top order fails and old faithful Usman Khawaja and Travis Head rescue the tourists' blushes.

title.children: Same old saviours rescue Aussies after 'woeful' top-order batting

image.altText: A glass-lid saucepan sits on a gas cooktop

props.synopsis: Australian Gas Networks has been accused of misleading "millions" of Australians through their "Love Gas" ads.Â

title.children: AGN accused of running dodgy 'Love Gas' ads that deceived viewers

image.altText: Aboriginal girl sitting in her garden and smiling

props.synopsis: With their hometown long troubled by youth crime, the children of Halls Creek have some clear ideas about what the community needs.

title.children: Outback kids back their town to find a solution to its troubles

image.altText: An adult white woman with long blonde hair and a black coat standing in front of a power point presentation

props.synopsis: New resources launched by Australia's Education Research Organisation will arm all teachers with the skills to teach writing.

title.children: 'Wasn't part of the syllabus': Australia's 30-year failure in teaching writing

image.altText: Ivona Jovanovic taking a selfie in a mirror in 2019

props.synopsis: A coroner determines Christos Panagakos was responsible for the 2019 shooting death of his former partner Ivona Jovanovic, but it was an accident.

title.children: Coroner says former partner accidentally killed Gold Coast woman

image.altText: Tim Williams looks at camera in blue shirt with a cup of coffee next to him

props.synopsis: Question marks hang over whether staff and suppliers of former popular bakery will see money they are owed as those in super industry call for tougher regulations.

title.children: 'We felt fairly deceived': Failed bakery All Are Welcome owes suppliers thousands

image.altText: Two policemen watch as a yellow crane truck lifts a metal box in grassland.

props.synopsis: Trent Thrupp, Stou Daniels and Davy Taiao have been sentenced after they were again found guilty of the 2016 murders of Iuliana Triscaru and Cory Breton.

title.children: Men sentenced to life in jail over 'cruel deaths' again after retrial

image.altText: A family looks out onto planes on the tarmac at an airport.

props.synopsis: In the days after the Air India crash, it was revealed that warnings had been issued about some of the airline's other planes. So, why isn't information like this always publicly available? And how can we know which airlines are safe?

title.children: Why getting info about airline safety records is harder than you think

image.altText: canned and fresh tomatoes on wooden rustic background

props.synopsis: This is what culinary experts have to say about choosing and using tinned tomatoes instead of fresh at home. Â Â

title.children: How to use tinned tomatoes as a substitute for fresh

image.altText: A man walks down some steps. He has his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: A serial rapist who attempted to abduct a teenage girl to rape her 45 years ago has avoided jail time.Â

title.children: Serial rapist who tried to abduct teen for sex avoids more jail

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: The move will exempt Games infrastructure from major planning laws, in a bid to ensure projects are not held up by potential legal challenges.

title.children: Queensland passes legislation to exempt Olympic venues from planning laws

image.altText: A red sign saying children's emergency and adults' emergency

props.synopsis: The chief executive of Western Sydney Local Health District will leave his position, following calls made by doctors at Sydney's Westmead Hospital for his resignation over allegations of patient safety concerns.

title.children: Health district CEO to leave role over cancer screening delays

image.altText: A young girl with red hair tucked into bed, lying on her side and blowing her nose.

props.synopsis: Winter can be a contagious time of year for everything from COVID-19 to the common cold, but there are ways to limit the risk of illnesses spreading from one family member or housemate to another. Â

title.children: What you can do to stop the spread of illness in your home
